patchNotes.title: Mini-hero rework and talent rework

texts.text: Additional functionality: Heat Tank: While under <vanilla, abilities, trait, 0> Sgt. Hammer can move at 50% of her base move speed but each time she auto attacks that movespeed decreases by 2.5% capping at 25% slowly regaining the speed after 2 seconds not shooting. Mounting reset the heat effect

general.developerCommentary: Changing Hammer to be mobile from beginning at the old <vanilla, talents, 7, 1> mode speed but with a catch so it won't just become baseline talent or it would be too strong.

patchNotes.developerCommentary: That rework will be based on the things that we could use on Sgt. Hammer and build my vision that would benefit the Hammer gameplay. One of the big things i dislike about how hammer is right now is the idea of not moving while under <modified, abilities, trait, 0> even tho we have a talent that let Hammer move and differently from some other talents it gives the same feeling of playing Cassia and not picking the active on level 7 it's like a core talent for your gameplay atleast that's how i feel BUT i like the idea of her having trouble to go with the team because she is naturally slower.

changes.name: <vanilla, talents, 1, 2>

texts.text: Changed functionality: Activate while in <modified, abilities, trait, 0> to increase Sgt Hammer attack speed by 60% for 3 seconds, Sgt Hammer won't be able to move during that duration, hitting enemy heroes or structures reduces the cooldown by 2 seconds

changes.developerCommentary: I didn't want to remove Maelstrom Rounds because of how much i like the interaction between a cooldown reduced on hitting enemy targets BUT i wanted to make it different and have i also wanted to make Hammer unmovable somehow like the 'old days'

changes.name: <vanilla, talents, 1, 0> renamed to Advanced Siege Tech

texts.text: Increase the <modified, abilities, trait, 0> and dismount speed by 100% and also grants unstopabble on that period

changes.developerCommentary: I do not think hammer tools are made to ambush enemies and it's rather used for the extra single target damage and with that in mind i think the other talents alredy cover that. I placed that new talent on level 1 for any one that want to play safer and could be eazily targeted with the drawback of losing a important damage skill

changes.name: New: Mounting spiders

texts.text: When you mount and dismount spawn 4 <modified, abilities, basic, 0> around Sgt. Hammer
When mount and dismount also heals 10% of Sgt. Hammer maximum health
Both effects are only activated on cooldown
Cooldown: 10s

changes.developerCommentary: This is supposed to synergise with a <modified, abilities, basic, 0> build but not be built on a way that makes you go for a <modified, abilities, basic, 0> build to pick it. Placed on level 4 due to be a sustain competitor. ALSO BOTH EFFECTS ARE ON COOLDOWN so you can't spam mount and dismount for healing

texts.text: removed

changes.name: <vanilla, talents, 7, 2>

texts.text: Changed functionality: While under <modified, abilities, trait, 0> if you don't shoot you progressively increase you range up to 3 and basic attack damage up to 200% on a period of 2.5seconds.

changes.developerCommentary: This is to make the graduating range somewhat similar to his old effect but also making a better synergy with the new heat passive

changes.name: <vanilla, talents, 7, 1>

texts.text: Changed functionality: Decrease Heat Tank speed lost with basic attacks to 1.25% also increase the maximum move speed to 60%

changes.developerCommentary: This if for the ones that still like to be the walking machines

changes.name: <vanilla, talents, 13, 1> renamed to Jump blast

texts.text: Activate to knock enemies around Sgt. Hammer and make her reposition herself with ground thrusters while on <modified, abilities, trait, 0>
Cooldown: 30s

changes.developerCommentary: We are adding the jump jets from SC2 on top of entrenched as it makes a similar effect of wanting to stay at the <modified, abilities, trait, 0> but repelling divers.

changes.name: <vanilla, talents, 13, 0>

texts.text: Additional Bonus: Increase <modified, abilities, basic, 0> duration by 200%

changes.developerCommentary: After thinking for long i think that this talent is cool and don't need drastic changes but a little spicy to make it more attractive on different gameplay styles.

changes.name: <vanilla, talents, 16, 1>

texts.text: Removed

changes.developerCommentary: It's a bland talent that serves it purpose BUT it's competing with other two talents that also serve the same purpose.

changes.name: NEW: Emp shoot

texts.text: Activate to empower Sgt. Hammer next attack to deal 600% extra damage to shield, stun the target hit for 0.75 seconds and knock back all targets that received collateral damage
Cooldown: 30s

changes.developerCommentary: I wanted to bring something that could replace Executioner without being directly targeted towards doing more damage but being a more situational one.

changes.name: NEW: Immortality Protocol

texts.text: After Sgt. Hammer dies she become a destroyed unit with 75% of her base hit points and can't be healed
If she is not kill under 5 seconds she will revive
Allied heros can interact with the debris, each interacting allied hero increases the revive speed by 50%
Cooldown: 90s

changes.developerCommentary: Immortality protocol was classic for me from Sc2 and it should be applied here on Hots too. Level 20 is very stacked with offensive options too and giving a chance for some utility would be good.

changes.name: <vanilla, talents, 20, 1> renamed to Advanced spider strike

texts.text: Won't increase the damage anymore
Additional functionality: Deploy 4 <modified, abilities, basic, 0> on explosion
Additional functionality: <modified, abilities, basic, 0> now decrease 5 armor up to 25 of enemy heroes hit for 4 seconds

changes.developerCommentary: <vanilla, talents, 20, 1> serves it purpose but directly competing on damage with <vanilla, talents, 20, 0> and <vanilla, talents, 20, 2> is hard because <vanilla, talents, 20, 1> doesn't feel like an extravagant upgrade compared with those two, we are changing it to better perform with the <modified, abilities, basic, 0> so you can give it a different appeal, if someone don't build mines there's no problem as they can just go for <modified, talents, 20, 3>.

changes.name: <vanilla, talents, 20, 2>

texts.text: Removed

changes.developerCommentary: With the changes made to the Advanced spider strike it's not necessary anymore
